result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Gerard McCready

records.addlTxt:
Cases 22CF65/ 22CF365 called together - 10:03 AM Defendant David Gerard McCready appeared by video from MSDF, in custody and by Atty. Rachel Boaz.  Atty. Adam Gerol appears for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Boaz will represent defendant on 22CF365. Defendant waives preliminary hearing on 22CF365. Court examines defendant, accepts waiver and binds case 22CF365 over for trial. State files information. Plea of not guilty entered. Defendant willing to appear on video from MSDF for future court dates.
Further proceedings scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on November 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's zoom appearance set for with MSDF.

10:11 AM Judge Cain sitting in for Judge Malloy - Defendant David Gerard McCready appeared by video from Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility.  Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz in court for David Gerard McCready.  Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel advises Defendant waives prompt disposition. Court examines Defendant and accepts waiver. October 12, 2022 court date to stay.
Clerk made arrangements for defendant to appear by zoom on 9/20 at 10:00 am.
Per direction of the Judge case to be scheduled for a status hearing regarding Defendant's filing of request for prompt disposition.  Status Hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 10:00 AM
Filed by DA's Office indicting rec'vd from def on 9/8/2022 - doc for review to clerk JM

10:27 AM Defendant David Gerard McCready in court by video from MSDF and by Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz in court for David Gerard McCready.  Attorney Antonella Aleman-Zientek in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing.  Defendant was not able to sign waiver form but wished to proceed without it signed. Court examines defendant, accepts waiver and binds case over for trial. Defendant waives reading of information, enters not guilty plea. State recommends for $30,000 cash bail w/conditions.
Further proceedings scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
